member.summary: Extension class for Object

member.summary: Serializes the specified object to a JSON string.
member.returns: A JSON string representation of the object.

members.member:
WORKAROUND: DbContext.Update() sometimes throws an InvalidOperationException: The instance of entity type 'X' cannot be tracked because another instance of this type with the same key is already being tracked. Normally I wasn't able to reproduce the bug, but if you stop the code at a breakpoint before Update() and expand the Results View of the _context.X object the issue will turn up. In this case, it is understandable, as you've enumerated the list and loaded the objects, so there will be two when you try to update, therefore the exception. But the exception has been thrown in deployed production environment, where it shouldn't. This solves the issue.
For more info: https://stackoverflow.com/questions/48117961/
Implement this interface in all DB model classes!
